title: Ticket #1473: file extension detection code is naive
description:
From this discussion on condor-users:

On Win32, Condor tries to find the extension associated with the pathname to an executable in order to consult the registry about what program is associated with running said extension type. Unfortunately, problems can result if the path to the executable itself contains a period due to embarrassingly naive file extension detection code. It only hunts backwards from the end of the filename until it finds a '.' character.

Easily fixed by calling condor_basename() before looking backwards for the '.' character.
